concise_definition: v. 消失, 消逝, 消灭

definitions.explanation_en: To cease to be visible or to no longer exist in a particular place or form, often suddenly or mysteriously.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某物突然或神秘地不再可见，或在某个地方或某种形式中不再存在。
definitions.example_en: The magician made the rabbit disappear in a puff of smoke.
definitions.example_cn: 魔术师在一团烟雾中让兔子消失了。

definitions.explanation_en: To fade out of existence, memory, or relevance over time; to become obsolete or forgotten.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指随着时间推移逐渐消失、被遗忘或失去重要性；变得过时或无人提及。
definitions.example_en: Many traditional crafts have disappeared as modern manufacturing took over.
definitions.example_cn: 随着现代制造业的兴起，许多传统工艺已经消失了。

definitions.explanation_en: To vanish from a situation, especially to leave without explanation or warning, often to avoid responsibility or danger.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从某种情境中突然离开，尤其是不加解释或警告地消失，常为逃避责任或危险。
definitions.example_en: After the scandal broke, the CEO disappeared without a trace.
definitions.example_cn: 丑闻曝光后，首席执行官便人间蒸发了。

comparison.analysis: “Vanish” (消失) 与 “disappear” 极为接近，常可互换，但 “vanish” 更强调彻底、神秘或超自然的消失，带有更强的戏剧性和不可解释性。例如：‘The spaceship vanished into thin air.’ 而 ‘disappear’ 更中性，可用于日常语境。
“Fade” (褪色/逐渐消失) 强调缓慢、渐进的过程，常用于颜色、声音或记忆的减弱。例如：‘The photo faded in the sunlight.’ 而 ‘disappear’ 通常暗示更突然或彻底的终结，不强调渐变过程。
“Evaporate” (蒸发/消散) 原指液体变为气体，引申为迅速或完全地消失，常用于抽象事物如信心、资金或机会。它带有‘无影无踪、不留痕迹’的意象，比 ‘disappear’ 更具物理隐喻色彩，多用于经济或情绪语境。
